thread.section_title: Mum killed after car smashed into her as she pushed pram with three kids – Metro
thread.title: Mum killed after car smashed into her as she pushed pram with three kids
thread.title_full: Mum killed after car smashed into her as she pushed pram with three kids

author: Jen
title: Mum killed after car smashed into her as she pushed pram with three kids
text:
A Volkswagen Beetle smashed into her and pinned her against a wall (Picture: Solent) A mother of three has died after a car smashed into her and pinned her against a wall as she pushed a her baby in a pram. 
The 37-year-old suffered severe leg injuries in the accident, which also injured all three of her children and left their father, in his 50s, with serious head injuries.
When is the Oxford vs Cambridge boat race 2017? What's the route and where can I watch it? A female driver of a black VW Beetle lost control and hit them before crashing into a cafe in Battle, East Sussex.
Sussex Police say they believe she may have been under the influence of alcohol when the collision happened yesterday at 1.55pm.
The parents were both rushed to the Royal Sussex County Hospital in Brighton, while the three children were taken to Conquest Hospital in Hastings, also East Sussex, after suffering minor injuries and shock following the crash.
Police and ambulances attended along with fire engines and a helicopter.
(Picture: Solent) Blood samples were taken from the driver at the scene, where she was treated by paramedics for a cut to her leg.
British backpacker was 'gangraped before being strangled to death' The Lounge cafe was today closed after the incident left customers trapped inside.
A Sussex Police spokesman today said: ‘At 1.55pm emergency services were called to the A2100 Upper Lake, Battle, where a black Volkswagen Beetle travelling west had collided with the family.
‘The woman driver and the three children, including an infant in a pram, sustained shock and minor injuries and were treated at the Conquest Hospital, St Leonards-on-Sea.
‘Sadly, the parents were both seriously injured, with the mother suffering potentially life-threatening injuries.
(Picture: Solent)  
‘Police examining the circumstances of the crash and are investigating reports the car driver may have been under the influence of alcohol when it occurred.
‘Blood samples were taken when she attended hospital and these have now been sent for analysis.’
Sergeant Peter Verney, of the Sussex Police roads policing unit, said: ‘Our thoughts are very much with the family at what is a very difficult time.’
South East Coast Ambulance service confirmed the mother was in a serious condition when she was taken to hospital with her partner.
Police have appealed for anyone with information on the collision to contact them.
